title: Parliament's Winter Session: Key Bills, Election Reforms & Ethics Probe
content:
The Indian Parliament's Winter Session is set to begin on December 4th and conclude on December 22nd, marking the first full session in the new Parliament building.  

This session is anticipated to be packed with key legislation, including the replacement of the Indian Penal Code, Criminal Procedure Code, and Evidence Act with their respective Bharatiya counterparts.  The appointment of the Chief Election Commissioner and Election Commissioners will also be debated, with a proposed selection committee involving the Prime Minister, Leader of the Opposition, and a nominated Union Cabinet Minister. 

Adding to the intrigue, the Lok Sabha Ethics Committee report on the cash-for-query allegations against Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra could be tabled, potentially leading to her expulsion from the Lok Sabha.
author: Scroll Staff
